channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Really bad broken slabs on Bibury road.someone is likely to get hurt

item.title: Unsafe path in Brizen, 5th September
item.description:
Large/deep cracks in path that goes around Brizen park. Itâ€™s very unsafe for small children on bikes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Salix Court, Up Hatherley

item.title: Seriously overgrown hedging, 5th September
item.description:
The hedges by the northbound pavement of the A435 Bishops Cleeve bypass (between the Stoke Road junction and Hayfield Way) are badly overgrown, with long thorny brambles hanging down at face level. This is a serious hazard for everyone, particularly those with visual impairments who could easily find themselves being badly injured. As such this should be rectified as a priority.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cranmere Stoke Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Upturned paving slab, 5th September
item.description:
Paving slab is likely to causing tripping. also pavement 1/2 normal width as hedge is leaving over

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 47 Byron Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bottles of urine, 4th September
item.description:
Walk through from Penrith Road to Grasmere Road has what looks like 3/4 large bottles of urine dumped. They have now been there for two weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Grasmere Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown highways verge, 4th September
item.description:
Redidents are concerned that this section of highways verge is so overgrown that it may cause safety issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Tewkesbury Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Is this tree going to be replaced?, 4th September
item.description:
There was a tree in the grass verge on The Park (near the junction with St Stephens Road) that suffered some damage and was chopped down about 18 months ago. Is it going to be replaced? Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Redesdale House, 85 The Park, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement Parking, 4th September
item.description:
Once again due to the fact I have a lamp post outside my house I could not actually get my mother in her wheel chair into my house due to large cars parking on the pavement outside the house. The car is over halfway on the pavement and now it looks as though a car has damaged my neighbours drainage when getting out or into its pavement parking space. This is the second complaint but by no means the second time its happened. Its a daily issue. Again the road was used as access to get into my house. Very dangerous with a wheel chair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 All Saints' Terrace, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faulty traffic light sensors, 3rd September
item.description:
Traffic lights on Winchcombe street at junction for A46 (heading away from Prestbury Road direction) cannot sense a solo motorcycle causing the red light to remain on even if nothing is coming from other directions. You either have to wait for a larger vehicle to come to trigger the lights, run the red light, or sit there and decompose.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 76 Winchcombe Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light casing open, 3rd September
item.description:
Light not workinf

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 33 Dunalley Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bush blocking path outside no. 69 pirton lane, 3rd September
item.description:
The bush outside number 69 pirton lane is hugely overgrown, half the pavement is blocked. It only ever gets lightly trimmed but needs a huge cut back to make the pavement accessible again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 73 Pirton Lane, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 43 Persimmon Gardens, Cheltenham

item.title: Roadwork signs blocking footpath., 1st September
item.description:

item.title: Traffic lights are in place but no Road works are underway, 1st September
item.description:
There are only three roads into the village: one is closed completely for road works; one is single track - and this one has Temporary traffic lights which are causing unnecessary traffic disruption.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Boleyn Cottages Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet
